result.execSummary:
The defendant Allen William Boser was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

cc: file, petitioner, ADA/victim, and DOC
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Pedro A. Colon, Br. 18, for review. jbs
Original Transcript (19 pages) commencing 07/17/2014 SENTENCING HEARING received and filed.
Count one.
Count two.

Defendant Allen William Boser in court with attorney Michael W Lutz.  Defendant Allen William Boser in custody.  Catelin A Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 1:   Sentencing proceeds. Statements made by the State, defense counsel and defendant. 
Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 40 MONTHS, consecutive to Count 2, with credit for ZERO days time served.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 16 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 24 MONTHS. 

Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Court finds defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

COURT STAYS sentence and places defendant on PROBATION for 3 YEARS under the supervision of the Wisconsin Department of Corrections.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION: 
* Comply with the standard rules of probation/extended supervision.
* Seek and maintain employment.
* Involvement in a job training program in order to enhance ability to obtain employment.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* PAY restitution in the amount of $1,000.00 to victim, Citlali M. - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* PAY restitution in the amount of $1,102.74 to victim, City of West Allis - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

OTHER COURT ORDERS:
* Conditions of extended supervision are the same as the conditions of probation.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

AS TO COUNT 2:    Sentencing proceeds. Statements made by the State, defense counsel and defendant..
Defendant sentenced to serve 6 MONTHS at the HOUSE OF CORRECTION, consecutive to Count 1, straight time, with credit for 117 days time served.

COURT ORDERS:
* PAY fine in the amount of $350.00.
* Defendant to PAY DNA surcharge - to be paid over a period of probation (ref. Count 1).  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* Defendant to PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges - to be paid over a period of probation (ref. Count 1).  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* Defendant's driver operating license is revoked for a period of 18 months.
* Defendant is not to drive any motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.
* Any motor vehicle titled in the defendant's name or driven by the defendant is to have an ignition interlock device installed for a period of 14 months.

Appeal rights given.

Filed:
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Court Orderfor IDP Related Offense Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Defendant's Blood Toxicology Report.
Defendant's Biohazard Credit Sheets.
RESTITUTION WORKSHEET as to victim, City of West Allis; filed.
with attached Restitution Worksheet from victim, Citlali M.; filed.
to Judge Donald; from the Detention Services Bureau regarding defendant having been selected in the Sheriff's Office Program and progress - filed.

Defendant Allen William Boser in court with attorney Michael W Lutz.  Defendant Allen William Boser in custody.  Catelin A Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form tendered to the Court.

AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2:    Defendant changes plea to "NO CONTEST". Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms or body armor. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

Upon State's motion and pursuant to negotiations, Court ordered Count 3 dismissed and read-in for sentencing purposes.

Parties request to adjourn the sentencing phase.
Court GRANTS request.
Case adjourned to 07-17-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Sentencing Hearing.

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.

Attorney Michael W Lutz in court, defendant Allen William Boser not in court, in custody.  Christopher Ladwig for Catelin A Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty. Lutz needs time to review State's offer with the defendant.
Parties request a projected plea hearing date.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.
Case adjourned to 06-10-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Projected Plea Hearing.

Attorney Michael W Lutz in court, defendant Allen William Boser not in court, in custody.  Catelin A Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter in court for a Bail/Bond Hearing and Scheduling Conference.

AS TO BAIL:  Bail is currently set at $2,500.00 cash.  Atty. Lutz requests a modification of bail to a reduced amount.  State objects.  Arguments heard.  
Court DENIED defense's motion to modify bail to a reduced amount.  Cash bail remains as $2,500.00 cash.

Parties request a status conference date.
Court GRANTS request.
Case adjourned to 05-12-2014 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Status Conference.

Defendant Allen William Boser in court with attorney Michael William Lutz.  Defendant Allen William Boser in custody.  Joann Hardtke for Catelin Autumn Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Michael Kempinski-West Allis Police Department Sargeant.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER TO WCS  for supervision upon release for the Repeat Intoxicated Driver Program.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug tests and portable breathalyzers.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Allen William Boser in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Defendant Allen William Boser in custody.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant enters a plea of not guilty as to misdemeanor counts 2 and 3.
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.
